part.narration: Yuki, in her house, begins to pick up the things she tossed about.
part.line: The Clan's embrace of malicious activity makes it a burden to play.
The Clan compromises the most powerful of systems and the most sensitive of data.
It was designed to repel both administrators and end users.
At least, the ones too weak to bear the consequences of playing it.
The game with actual, life-impacting consequences —
Hey, let's go to the club.
I don't really know if I want to —
part.narration: Sudden cut.Nozomi and Yuki, holding hands while in flapper dress, stand at a door. This is their stop.

Club Sega, Akihabara. The outside of the club is gold-trimmed and wiped-windowed. Maintenance is expensive. We're in a recession. The inside of the club is no different. A string quartet plays Canon in D. All are in dress and suit. A man at the front welcomes Yuki and Nozomi.
part.line: Yes, I have. It's the table between Harrier Hideaway and Fantasy Zone—
To the table with you both, and no delay!
part.narration: Nozomi and Yuki sit at the Magic Touch. Grafted into the table is a cabinet of some sort of cooperative alien-shooting game. The cabinet was modified so the two players must sit extremely close to each other. There are glasses of fine wines at each end of the table. The couple plays a round. Yuki fidgets a little. Nozomi takes her hands from the controls and rubs Yuki.
Nozomi gets out of the seat. Yuki rises. Nozomi shivers. She kneels down and pulls out something shiny.

Yuki twitches — Her hands behind her back — scrape against each other — She pulls one hand out. Before Yuki's Eyes — in her hands — something shiny — a gun. The world fades away — Yuki cocks the gun and points-blank at Nozomi.

condition.comment: The Player is allowed unlimited time to make the choice.

choice.narration: Yuki shoots her in the face. Yuki gasps, every inflection of Nozomi's voice in panic — in loss — in death — permeating her thought. Oh God. That wasn't real, that wasn't real —
The drops out of Yuki's hands.

part.narration: Yuki stoops down to Nozomi's level. She jumps at her. She lays atop her horizontal on the floor of the arcade in the room full of other people, watching — staring — judging — Yuki, crying.
part.line: My dear wife — I'm so wrong.
